title: minerjones
author: minerjones
created_time: December 29, 2022, 03:52:59 PMLast edit: December 29, 2022, 04:38:05 PM by minerjones
content: LOT 1: 2014 Geek Bitcoin 5mbtc gold plated brass coinLOT 2: 2014 Geek Bitcoin 5mbtc gold plated brass coinLOT 3: 2013 Lelana 0.1BTC brass coin #2076 "16xVKQ25" BUYER FUNDEDSTARTING BID PER LOT: 0.0001BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0001BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal places**END TIME: JANUARY 3rd, 2023, 13:00:00 PDT**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.PAYMENT: Bitcoin BTC. A signed PGP message will be sent to winner with payment addressSHIPPING: Based on location and preference

comments.author: JanEmil
comments.body: Lot 1 @ 0.001Does anyone have the full list with addresses for 2013 Lelana 0.1BTC brass coins ?

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: JanEmil on December 29, 2022, 06:31:32 PMLot 1 @ 0.001Quote from: elianite on December 29, 2022, 05:46:07 PMLot 2 @ 0.0005BTCLot 3 @ 0.0010BTCCurrent high bidsQuote from: JanEmil on December 29, 2022, 06:31:32 PMDoes anyone have the full list with addresses for 2013 Lelana 0.1BTC brass coins ?I don't think the Buyer Funded coins were ever listed... think it was just the ones originally funded by the maker

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: These Geek BTC coins are unfunded, right?I tried checking the Maker thread but couldn't find anything on them.And regarding the lealana: Is there any info on how many funded vs unfunded exist?Lot 2: 0.0006Lot 3: 0.0011

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on December 29, 2022, 10:24:02 PMThese Geek BTC coins are unfunded, right?I tried checking the Maker thread but couldn't find anything on them.And regarding the lealana: Is there any info on how many funded vs unfunded exist?Lot 2: 0.0006Lot 3: 0.0011The Geek coins were DIY and there's no way to differentiate between them once assembled. I have personally peeled more than 10 and none were funded, but there's no real way to tell without peeling.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: JanEmil on December 29, 2022, 06:31:32 PMLot 1 @ 0.001Quote from: Kryptowerk on December 29, 2022, 10:24:02 PMLot 2: 0.0006Lot 3: 0.0011Current high bidsQuote from: Kryptowerk on December 29, 2022, 10:24:02 PMThese Geek BTC coins are unfunded, right?I tried checking the Maker thread but couldn't find anything on them.And regarding the lealana: Is there any info on how many funded vs unfunded exist?Not sure... and no way to check.Best I could find was this sales thread from another collector from 2018: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5086270They do mention something on this near the end of the thread, but nothing concrete on the matter.And checking the wayback machine does show their website, but no leads to the coin that were offered:https://web.archive.org/web/20141108102616/http://www.geekbitcoin.com/The big yellow book states there were 10,000 of the Lealana 0.1 btc brass coins produced.... showing 100 BF black addys and 9500 green addys. Not sure how many of those green addresses were BF ??
